subject: Northside Audiology - Website Contact Form – Referral Upload and Data Security Inquiry

full_threads.body:
Good morning Natalie,

Thank you for your enquiry regarding adding an upload feature to your contact form on northsideaudiology.com.au. 

As your site is built on WordPress, we can implement this using Gravity Forms, which supports secure file uploads.

1. Upload Functionality
Yes, we can add an upload field to your existing contact form to allow clients and referring doctors to submit PDF, JPEG, PNG, or other approved file types along with their referral. 
  • The uploaded document can be delivered directly as an email attachment to your nominated inbox.
  • We can also restrict file size and type to maintain performance and security.

2. Data Protection During Upload/Transmission
Gravity Forms can be configured to:
  • Use SSL/HTTPS encryption during upload to ensure files are encrypted in transit.
  • Avoid long-term storage on the server by delivering files directly via email (or deleting them automatically after delivery).
  • If temporary storage is required, ensure it is protected by server-level access restrictions and automatic cleanup.

3. Data Storage & Privacy Compliance (Kinsta Hosting)
Your site is hosted with Kinsta, which uses Google Cloud’s Sydney data centre for Australian accounts. 

This ensures any files temporarily stored on the server remain within Australia, aligning with the Privacy Act 1988 and the Australian Privacy Principles.

Additional safeguards we recommend:
  • Confirming your email service is also hosted in Australia (or otherwise compliant with Australian privacy regulations).
  • Using strong access controls so only authorised staff can access referral files.
  • If required, configuring the form so files are deleted immediately after being emailed to your secure inbox, ensuring no health data is retained online.

4. Email Handling & Form Fields
Just one more thing before we get started:
  • How would you like referral emails to be handled once they arrive in your inbox?
    • For example, will they be stored, printed, or forwarded to your team? Knowing this will help us make sure everything stays privacy-compliant and secure.
  • Could you also let us know what fields you'd like included in the form?
    • If it’s the standard fields (name, phone, email, message, file upload), setup will be straightforward
    • If there’s anything more custom or with conditional logic, this may require additional configurations
5. Cost Estimate
Our estimate for implementation, testing, and privacy configuration is 1- 4 hours depending on the complexity of the form fields and any additional email conditions.

Let me know if you have any questions or if you'd like us to get started, always happy to help!

Good morning Natalie,
Thank you for your enquiry regarding adding an upload feature to your contact form on northsideaudiology.com.au. As your site is built on WordPress, we can implement this using Gravity Forms, which supports secure file uploads.

1. Upload Functionality

Yes, we can add an upload field to your existing contact form to allow clients and referring doctors to submit PDF, JPEG, PNG, or other approved file types along with their referral. The uploaded document can be delivered directly as an email attachment to your nominated inbox. We can also restrict file size and type to maintain performance and security.

2. Data Protection During Upload/Transmission

Gravity Forms can be configured to:
  • Use SSL/HTTPS encryption during upload to ensure files are encrypted in transit.
  • Avoid long-term storage on the server by delivering files directly via email (or deleting them automatically after delivery).
  • If temporary storage is required, ensure it is protected by server-level access restrictions and automatic cleanup.

3. Data Storage & Privacy Compliance (Kinsta Hosting)

Your site is hosted with Kinsta, which uses Google Cloud’s Sydney data centre for Australian accounts. This ensures any files temporarily stored on the server remain within Australia, aligning with the Privacy Act 1988 and the Australian Privacy Principles.
Additional safeguards we recommend:
  • Confirming your email service is also hosted in Australia (or otherwise compliant with Australian privacy regulations).
  • Using strong access controls so only authorised staff can access referral files.
  • If required, configuring the form so files are deleted immediately after being emailed to your secure inbox, ensuring no health data is retained online.

4. Email Handling & Form Fields

Could you please confirm what will happen to the referral emails once they are received in your inbox? For example, will they be stored long-term, printed, or forwarded internally? This will help us ensure the workflow remains fully compliant with privacy requirements.

In addition, could you send us the specific fields you would like included in the contact form? If they are standard fields (e.g., name, phone, email, message, file upload), setup will be straightforward. If the form includes more complex conditional logic or custom data capture, this may require additional configuration.

5. Cost Estimate

Our estimate for implementation, testing, and privacy configuration is 1–4 hours depending on the complexity of the form fields and any additional email conditions.

Let me know if you have any other questions, we are always happy to answer

Good afternoon Natalie,

Thank you so much for your enquiry, we completely understand the importance of protecting sensitive health information, and we’re happy to advise you on how this can be safely and legally implemented on your website.

Please see our responses below:

1. Is it possible to add an upload function to the contact form?

Yes, absolutely. We can add an upload field to your homepage contact form, allowing users such as clients or referring doctors, to securely attach referral documents (e.g., PDFs, JPEGs, PNGs). These will be sent along with the form submission and received safely by your team.

2. How is the data protected during upload and transmission?

Security is a top priority, especially when dealing with health-related information. Here’s how the data is protected:
  • Encrypted Transmission (HTTPS): Your site already uses HTTPS, meaning all information (including file uploads) is encrypted during transfer and cannot be intercepted in transit.
  • Restricted Access to Uploaded Files: We configure uploads so they are not publicly accessible. Only authorised users (your admin team) will be able to view or download the documents.
  • Ongoing Monitoring and Updates: Your website is managed under a care plan that includes BlogVault, which ensures that all security patches and plugin updates are applied promptly. BlogVault also monitors for any suspicious activity and keeps daily backups.
  • We can't save specific emails data since it goes through the specific email set-up by that form

3. Where is the uploaded data stored? Is it based in Australia?

Yes , your site is hosted with Kinsta, which uses Google Cloud Platform. We have confirmed that:
  • Your website’s data , including any uploaded documents , is hosted in Google Cloud’s Sydney data centre, meaning all data remains within Australia.
  • Google Cloud complies with the Australian Privacy Act 1988 and the Australian Privacy Principles (APPs), covering how sensitive information must be collected, used, and stored.
For additional reassurance:
  • 📄 Google Cloud’s APP Compliance Summary (PDF)
  • 🌐 Google Cloud Compliance Overview
Cloudflare is also used as part of your site’s infrastructure, but it does not store uploaded files. It only assists with performance and security, without affecting the storage location of sensitive data.

4. What is the cost to implement this feature?

We estimate, this will take us 2-4 hour depending on how complicated the form is. If you can send us the necessary fields we can know how long it would take:
  • Add and configure the secure upload field
  • Set appropriate file size and type restrictions
  • Configure secure file access rules
  • Test the form to ensure safe delivery and handling of referrals
All regular updates such as plugins and security monitoring are already covered under your existing care plan.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Good afternoon,

Your team looks after our website northsideaudiology.com.au. We would like to explore the possibility of adding a new feature to our homepage contact form, allowing clients and referring doctors to upload referrals directly through the form, with the document arriving as an attachment in our inbox.

Could you please advise:
  1. Is it possible to add an upload function to the contact form so users can attach referrals (e.g., PDF or image files)?
  2. If so, how is the data protected during the upload and transmission process?
  3. Where is the uploaded data stored? Specifically, we'd like to confirm whether the cloud storage or any intermediary services involved are based in Australia, in line with local privacy and data protection regulations.

As this would involve sensitive health information, ensuring compliance with Australian privacy laws (such as the Privacy Act 1988) is essential for us.

  1. How much would this cost?
We look forward to your advice on feasibility, best practices for implementation, and any associated costs.


Kind Regards


Natalie
Practice Manager



Simply better hearing.


Chatswood | Bella Vista | Neutral Bay | Gladesville
www.northsideaudiology.com.au
Tel: 94196999 - Suite 2/1-3 Havilah Street, Chatswood NSW 2067


Northside Audiology is a privately owned, independent company providing diagnostic audiology and rehabilitation services. We are not owned by, or aligned with, any hearing device manufacturer. We access hearing aids and implantable devices from a number of manufacturers based on our client's needs and preferences. Our audiologists do not receive any commission or incentive for fitting particular devices.
